title: Easing Deluge Brings Relief for Rain-Soaked Towns
description: A general view as rain delays play during the WBBL match between Sydney Thunder and Hobart Hurricanes at GIANTS Stadium, in Sydney, Australia, on Nov. 9, 2023. (Mark Metcalfe/Getty Images)

title: NZ Government to Mandate 1 Hour for Math, Reading, Writing for Primary School Students
description: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon (C) and Education Minister Erica Stanford (L) look on during a school assembly at Manurewa Intermediate School on Dec. 01, 2023 in Auckland, New Zealand. (Photo by Phil Walter/Getty Images)

title: Man With Ties to Vancouver, Edmonton and Halifax Killed in Calgary Drive-By Shooting
description: Calgary Police Service attend a scene in Calgary on Oct. 18, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Jeff McIntosh)

title: Thousands of Trees Will Be Felled in Vancouver’s Stanley Park Due to Moth Infestation
description:
A cyclist rides on the road in Stanley Park in Vancouver, B.C., Oct. 2, 2020. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

title: Ontario School Board Trustee Says Pro-Palestinian Protester Grabbed Him During Meeting Disruption
description: Protesters wave Palestinian flags in Los Angeles, Calif., on Oct. 12, 2023. (John Fredricks/The Epoch Times)

title: Launch of Digital Pound Must Not Be Considered Inevitable: Treasury Committee Warns

title: Police ‘Surrounded’ at Pro-Palestine Event After Making Arrests

title: 7.6 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Southern Philippines and Tsunami Warning Is Issued
description: A map shows the location of a powerful earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.6 that struck Saturday night off the coast of the southern Philippine island of Mindanao on Dec. 2, 2023. (USGS/Screenshot via The Epoch Times)

title: Argentina Won’t Join China-Led BRICS, Says Member of Milei’s Transition Team
description: President-elect Javier Milei waves during a joint session of Congress to officially declare him and his running mate winners of the presidential runoff election in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Nov. 29, 2023. (Natacha Pisarenko/AP Photo)

title: Private School Students Fared Better During COVID-19 School Lockdowns: Cardus Report
description: Personal protection equipment is seen on the teacher's desk in classroom in preparation for the new school year at the Willingdon Elementary School in Montreal, on Aug. 26, 2020. (Paul Chiasson/The Canadian Press)

title: David Krayden: Holding a Climate Change Conference in the Desert Is Surreal
description: A billboard advertising COP28 in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, on Nov. 27, 2023. Representatives are gathering in the city for the 28th Conference of the Partners summit, which runs from Nov. 30 to Dec. 12, 2023. (AP Photo/Kamran Jebreili)

title: Putin Orders Russian Military to Add 170,000 Troops for Total of 1.32 Million
description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin meeting with young scientists at the Sirius Park of Science and Art in the southern Krasnodar region, Russia, on Nov. 29, 2023. (Mikhail Klimentyev/Pool/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Rising Threat From China Prompts Vietnam and Japan to Elevate Bilateral Relations
description: Vietnam's President Vo Van Thuong (L) is welcomed by Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida during his visit to the prime minister's official residence in Tokyo on Nov. 27, 2023. (Richard A. Brooks / POOL / AFP via Getty Images)

title: Heavy Snow Hits Flights as Temperatures Plunge Across UK
description: Snow in Glasgow as scattered weather warnings for snow and ice are in place across the UK on Dec. 2, 2023. (Lucinda Cameron/PA)

title: Police Charge More Than 40 Away Fans After Major Disorder Outside Villa Park
description: Police officers with dogs as flares are set off outside Villa Park football stadium in Aston, Birmingham, England, on Nov. 31, 2023. (David Davies/PA)

title: South Korea Launches Its First Spy Satellite After North Korea Does the Same
description: South Korea launches its first military spy satellite from Vandenberg Space Force Base, Calif., on Dec. 1, 2023. (SpaceX via AP)

title: CSIS to Probe BC Office After Allegations of Rape, Harassment and Toxic Workplace
description: Two Canadian Security Intelligence Service surveillance officers pose for a photograph in Vancouver on Oct. 18, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

title: ‘We Can’t Let It Fail’: More Government Cash for Coal Mine
description: Australia’s largest coal producer Glencore exported 15.5 million tons of thermal coal in the third quarter of this year, a year-over-year increase of 15 percent, according to the company’s Q3 report. (Robert Cianflone/Getty Images)

title: Ontario Regional Police Search for Escaped Kangaroo
description: Grey kangaroos feed on grass near Canberra, Australia, on March 15, 2008. (Mark Graham/AP Photo)

title: More Volunteers Sought From Generous Nation of Donators

title: Coles Gets Green Light for $105 Million Milk Plants Purchase
description: People line up outside a Coles supermarket in Melbourne, Australia, on Aug. 2, 2020. (Darrian Traynor/Getty Images)

title: Ontario School Board Meeting Disrupted by Pro-Palestinian Protesters
description: Pro-Palestine protesters marched along Bay Street in downtown Toronto on Oct. 9, 2023. They were seen holding large banners, including one that reads "Smash Israeli Apartheid, Free Palestine," and another that reads "Resistance is Justified When People Are Occupied." (Andrew Chen/The Epoch Times)

title: Critics Circle After Olympic Project Funding Claims
description: A supplied image obtained on Nov. 24, 2023, shows an artist's depiction of the new-look layout for the Gabba precinct which will be rebuilt ahead of the 2032 Olympics. The Gabba will be completely demolished and rebuilt to become the centrepiece of the Brisbane 2032 Olympics as part of a $2.7 billion project. (AAP Image/Supplied by Queensland Government)
